final_answer:
This image is funny and satirical because it juxtaposes two contradictory actions involving pumpkin seeds. On the left, a hand is seen discarding pumpkin seeds from a freshly carved pumpkin into a trash can, a common practice during pumpkin carving. Meanwhile, on the right, a man is contently eating pumpkin seeds from a store-bought bag. 

The humor arises from the irony of discarding natural pumpkin seeds while simultaneously consuming identical seeds that have been purchased separately. It highlights the absurdity of overlooking readily available natural resources while opting for the convenience of pre-packaged items, a satire on consumer habits.
